intro: Myanthus callosus, commonly known as the roughleaf myanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Myanthus callosus is adapted to wet environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
